question.name: 36.1.4.2 Graphical representations/ Pie charts
question.questiontext:
Pie charts

Pie charts are often seen in magazines and newspapers. A pie chart is simply a circular diagram where the circle is divided into sectors and the angles of the sectors are proportional to the quantity represented. The quantities may be the frequencies of values of a categorical variable in a sample. Since the total area of the circle is fixed, pie charts are considered to be useful for representing proportions of a total.

The following data represent the time spent weekly on a variety of activities by the full-time employees of an engineering company.

Hours spent on:MalesFemales
Travel to and from work10.58.4
Paid activities in employment47.037.0
Personal sport and leisure activities8.23.6
Personal development5.66.4
Family activities8.418.2
Sleep56.056.0
Other32.338.4

To construct a pie chart showing how the male employees spend their time we proceed as follows. Note that the total number of hours spent is 168 (\(7\times 24\)).

  1. Express the time spent on any given activity as a proportion of the total time spent;
  2. Multiply the number obtained by 360 thus converting the proportion to an angle, in degrees;
  3. Draw a chart consisting of (in this case) 6 sectors having the angles given in the table below subtended at the centre of the circle.
Hours spent on:MalesProportion of TimeSector Angle
Travel to and from work\(10.5\)\(\dfrac{10.5}{168}\)\(\dfrac{10.5}{168}\times 360^{\circ}=22.5^{\circ}\)
Paid activities in employment\(47.0\)\(\dfrac{47}{168}\)\(\dfrac{47}{168}\times 360^{\circ}=100.7^{\circ}\)
Personal sport and leisure activities\(8.2\)\(\dfrac{8.2}{168}\)\(\dfrac{8.2}{168}\times 360^{\circ}=17.6^{\circ}\)
Personal development\(5.6\)\(\dfrac{5.6}{168}\)\(\dfrac{5.6}{168}\times 360^{\circ}=12.0^{\circ}\)
Family activities\(8.4\)\(\dfrac{8.4}{168}\)\(\dfrac{8.4}{168}\times 360^{\circ}=18.0^{\circ}\)
Sleep\(56.0\)\(\dfrac{56}{168}\)\(\dfrac{56}{168}\times 360^{\circ}=120.0^{\circ}\)
Other\(32.3\)\(\dfrac{32.3}{168}\)\(\dfrac{32.3}{168}\times 360^{\circ}=69.2^{\circ}\)
